intro: Pedicularis gruina subsp. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
